page.title: 16Sir John Barrow of Ulverston
page.content: Sir John Barrow was born in 1764 in the hamlet of Dragley Beck. Behind the cottage where he was born runs a stream which gave the hamlet its name. After attending the local school,his interest in navigation and astronomy took him on a whaling expedition to the Antarctic,followed by travels to China and S.Africa. When he returned to England he became{Secretary to the {Admiralty}and wrote "Mutiny on the Bounty". He helped establish the{Royal {Geographical Society.}He died in 1845 at the age of 85. A primary school in Ulverston is named after him. {Hoad Monument,}a 100 ft. high lime- stone tower in the form of a light- house was built in his honour in 1850, on Hoad Hill above the town. Today Hoad Monument is an Ulverston land- mark which can be seen for miles around.
